alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 1:11PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Two Rounds of Snow for the Southern Interior and Alaska Range through Friday... Two additional rounds of snow will impact the southern Interior and Alaska Range through Friday, with the next coming Wednesday and Wednesday night. This first system will bring 3 to 5 inches of snowfall, heaviest in the Alaska Range. There will be a sharp cutoff to the north, with 1 to 2 inches of snow from Nenana to Fairbanks, with little to no accumulation north of Fairbanks. The next round of snow is expected Thursday through Friday, which will bring an additional 3 to 7 inches of snowfall, once again the heaviest over the Alaska Range. Expect accumulating snow this time to reach as far north as the Elliott Highway, with 2 to 4 inches possible in the Fairbanks area. Stay tuned for more updates on this system. For the latest forecast go to weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
